intro: Ononis cristata subsp. ayachica, commonly known as the Ayachica whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, contributing to its ornamental value. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential for medicinal use.
